2.t: A book has been revealed to you, (Muhammad). You should not hesitate to convey its warning and its good advice to the believers.
2.tr: Kitaabun unzila ilaika falaa yakun fee sadrika harajum minhu litunzira bihee Wa-zikraa lilmu'mineen

3.t: (People), follow whatever is revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other guardians besides Him. However, you pay very little attention (to Our words)
3.tr: Ittabi'oo maaa unzila 'ilaikum mir Rabbikum Wa-laa tattabi'oo min dooniheee awliyaaa'; qaleelam maa tazakkaroon

4.t: How many cities have We destroyed! Our wrath struck their people at night or during their midday siesta.
4.tr: Wa-kam min qaryatin ahlaknaahaa fajaaa'ahaa ba'sunaa bayaatan aw hum qaaa'iloon

5.t: When Our wrath struck them, they could do nothing but confess to their sins.
5.tr: Famaa kaana da'waahum iz jaaa'ahum ba'sunaa illaaa an qaalooo innaa kunnaa zaalimeen

6.t: We will certainly question the people and the Messengers sent to them.
6.tr: Falanas'alannal lazeena ursila ilaihim Wa-lanas'alannal mursaleen

7.t: We will tell them with absolute certainty (what they had done) for We had never been absent from them (during their lifetime).

8.t: (Everyone's deeds) will certainly be weighed (and evaluated) on the Day of Judgment. Those whose good deeds weigh heavier than their bad deeds will have everlasting happiness.
8.tr: Walwaznu Yawma'izinil haqq(u), faman saqulat mawaa-zeenuhoo fa-ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon

9.t: As for those whose bad deeds weigh heavier, they will lose their souls for their injustice to Our revelations.
9.tr: Wa-man khaffat mawaazeenuhoo fa-ulaaa'ikal lazeena khasirooo anfusahum bimaa kaanoo bi-Aayaatinaa yazlimoon

10.t: We have made you inhabit the land and provided you with the means of sustenance. Only a few of you give thanks.
10.tr: Wa-laqad makkannaakum fil ardi Wa-ja'alnaa lakum feehaa ma'aayish; qaleelam maa tashkuroon

11.t: We created and shaped you, then told the angels to prostrate themselves before Adam. All the angels obeyed except Satan who did not.
11.tr: Wa-laqad khalaqnaakum summa sawwar-naakum summa qulnaa lil-malaaa'ikatis judoo li-Aadama fa-sajadooo illaaa Ibleesa lam yakum minas saajideen

12.t: God asked, "What made you disobey Me?" Satan replied, "I am better than Adam, for You have created me out of fire and Adam out of clay."
12.tr: Qaala maa mana'aka allaa tasjuda iz amartuk(a) qaala ana khairum minhu khalaqtanee min naarinw Wa-khalaqtahoo min teen

13.t: The Lord ordered Satan to get out (of Paradise) saying, "This is no place for you to be proud. Get out of this place, for you are worthless".
13.tr: Qaala fahbit minhaa famaa yakoonu laka an ta-ta-kabbara feehaa fakhruj innaka minas saaghireen

14.t: Satan asked the Lord to give him respite (keep him alive) until the Day of Resurrection.

15.t: The Lord told him, "We will grant you this respite."

16.t: Then Satan said, "Because you have made me go astray, I shall certainly try to seduce people into straying from the right path.
16.tr: Qaala fabimaaa aghwai-tanee la-aq'udanna lahum siraa-takal mustaqeem

17.t: I shall attack them from all directions and You will not find many of them giving You thanks".
17.tr: Summa la-aatiyan-nahum mim baini aideehim Wa-min khalfihim Wa-'an aimaa-nihim Wa-'an shamaaa'ilihim Wa-laa tajidu aksarahum shaakireen

18.t: The Lord told Satan, "Get out of this garden, for you are banished and despised. Hell will be filled with all of those who follow you."
18.tr: Qaala khruj minhaa maz'oomam madhooraa(l); laman tabi'aka minhum la-amla'anna Jahannama minkum ajma'een

19.t: Then the Lord said, "Adam, stay in the garden with your spouse and eat whatever you want therein, but do not go near this tree lest you transgress".
19.tr: Wa-yaaa-Aadamus kun anta Wa-zawjukal Jannata fakulaa min haisu shi'tumaa Wa-laa taqrabaa haazihish shajarata fatakoonaa minaz zaalimeen

20.t: Satan tempted them to reveal that which was kept private from them and said, "Your Lord has not prohibited you (to eat the fruits of this tree) unless you want to be angels or immortal."
20.tr: Fawaswasa lahumash shaitaanu liyubdiya lahumaa maa wooriya 'anhumaa min saw-aatihimaa Wa-qaala maa nahaakumaa Rabbukumaa 'an haazihish shajarati illaaa an takoonaa malakaini aw takoonaa minal khaalideen

21.t: Satan swore before them that he was giving them good advice.

22.t: Thus, he deceitfully showed them (the tree). When they had tasted (fruits) from the tree, their private parts became revealed to them and they began to cover their private parts with leaves from the garden. Their Lord then called out to them saying, "Did I not forbid you to eat (fruits) from the tree and tell you that Satan was your sworn enemy?"
22.tr: Fadal-laahumaa bighuroor; falammaa zaaqash shajarata badat lahumaa saw-aatuhumaa Wa-tafiqaa yakh-sifaani 'alaihimaa minw waraqil jannah(ti) Wa-naadaa-humaa Rabbuhumaaa alam anha-kumaa 'an til-kumash shajarati Wa-aqul lakumaaa innash shaitaana lakumaa 'aduwwum mubeen

23.t: They replied, "Lord, we have done injustice to our souls. If You will not forgive us and have mercy on us, we shall certainly have incurred a great loss."
23.tr: Qaalaa Rabbanaa zalamnaaa anfusanaa Wa-il lam taghfir lanaa Wa-tarhamnaa lana-koo-nanna minal khaasireen

24.t: The Lord told them to leave the garden as each other's enemies and go to earth to dwell and benefit from the means therein for an appointed time.
24.tr: Qaalah bitoo ba'dukum liba'din a'duww(unw), Wa-lakum fil ardi mustaqarrunw Wa-mataa'un ilaa heen

25.t: He told them that, on earth, they would live, die, and be resurrected.
25.tr: Qaala feehaa tah-yawna Wa-feehaa tamoo-toona Wa-minhaa tukhrajoon

26.t: Children of Adam, We have given you clothing to cover your private parts and for beauty, but the robe of piety is the best. Thus is the guidance of God so that you may take heed.
26.tr: Yaa-Baneee Aadama qad anzalnaa 'alaikum libaa-saien yuwaaree saw-aatikum Wa-reesha(nw) Wa-libaasut taqwaa zaalika khair; zaalika min Aayaatil laahi la'allahum yaz-zakkaroon

27.t: Children of Adam, do not let Satan seduce you, as he caused your parents to be expelled from the garden and made them take off their clothes in order to show them their private parts. Satan and those like him see you but you do not see them. We have made the Satans as friends for those who have no faith.
27.tr: Yaa-Banee Aadama laa yafti-nanna-kumush shaitaanu kamaaa akhraja aba-waikum minal Jannah(ti) yanzi'u 'anhumaa libaasa-humaa liyuri-yahumaa saw-aati-himaaa; innahoo yaraakum huwa Wa-qabeeluhoo min haisu laa tarawnahum; innaa ja'alnash shayaateena awliyaaa'a lillazeena laa yu'minoon

28.t: When (The faithless) commit indecent acts they say, "We found our fathers doing this and God has commanded us to do the same." (Muhammad) tell them that God does not command anyone to commit indecency. Do you speak for God, saying things of which you have no knowledge?
28.tr: Wa-izaa fa'aloo faahishatan qaaloo wajadnaa 'alaihaaa aabaaa'ana wallaahu ama-ranaa bihaa; qul innal laaha laa ya'muru bilfah-shaaa(i) a-taqooloona 'alal laahi maa laa ta'lamoon

29.t: Say, "My Lord has ordered me to maintain justice. (People), pay due attention (when worshipping God). Pray to Him sincerely and be devoted in your religion. Just as He gave you life, He will bring you back to life again (after you die.)"
29.tr: Qul amara Rabbee bil-qisti Wa-aqeemoo wujoohakum 'inda kulli masjid(inw) wad'oohu mukhliseena lahud deen(a); kamaa bada-akum ta'oodoon

30.t: He has guided one group (of people) and the other group go is doomed to astray; the latter group took Satan as their guardian instead of God and thought that they were rightly guided.
30.tr: Fareeqan hadaa Wa-fareeqan haqqa 'alaihimud dalaalah; innahumut takhazush shayaateena awliyaaa'a min doonil laahi Wa-yah-saboona annahum muhtadoon

31.t: Children of Adam, dress well when attending the mosques, eat and drink but do not be excessive for God does not love those who are excessive (in what they do).
31.tr: Yaa-Banee Adama khuzoo zeenatakum 'inda kulli masjidinw Wa-kuloo wash-raboo Wa-laa tusrifoo; innahoo laa yuhibbul musrifeen

32.t: (Muhammad), ask them, "Who has made it unlawful to maintain beauty and to eat the pure foods which God has created for His servants? They are made for the believers in this world and are exclusively for them in the life hereafter." Thus do We explain Our revelations to the people who have knowledge.
32.tr: Qul man harrama zeenatal laahil lateee akhraja li'ibaadihee wat-taiyyi-baati minar rizq; qul hiya lil-lazeena aamanoo fil hayaatid dunyaa khaali-sataien Yawmal Qiyaamah; kazaalika nufassilu(l) Aayaati liqaw-mien ya'lamoon

33.t: (Muhammad), tell them, "My Lord has only prohibited indecent acts committed in public or in secret, all sins, unjust rebellion, considering things equal to God without any heavenly authority, and speaking for God without having any knowledge (of what He has said)."
33.tr: Qul innamaa harrama Rabbiyal fawaa-hisha maa zahara minhaa wa-maa batana wal-isma wal-baghya bighairil haqqi Wa-an tushrikoo billaahi maa lam yunazzil bihee sultaananw wa-an taqooloo 'alal laahi maa laa ta'lamoon

34.t: All people can only live for an appointed time. When their term ends, they will not remain (alive) even for a single hour, nor will they die before the appointed time.
34.tr: Wa-likulli ummatin ajal(un), fa-izaa jaaa'a ajaluhum laa yasta'-khiroona saa'atanw wa-laa yastaq-dimoon

35.t: Children of Adam, when Messengers from among your own people come to you to preach My revelations, those who choose piety and reform themselves will have nothing to fear nor will they be grieved.
35.tr: Yaa-Banee Aadama immaa ya'ti-yannakum Rusulum minkum yaqus-soona 'alaikum Aayaatee famanit taqaa wa-aslaha falaa khawfun 'alaihim wa-laa hum yahzanoon

36.t: But those who have rejected Our revelations out of pride will be the dwellers of hell fire wherein they will live forever.
36.tr: Wallazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa wastakbaroo 'an-haaa ulaaa'ika As-haabun naari hum feehaa khaalidoon

37.t: Who are more unjust than those who invent falsehoods against God and reject His revelations? These will have their share (of torment) which is ordained for them and when Our (angelic) Messengers come to them to cause them to die and ask them, "Where are those whom you had been worshipping besides God?" they will reply, "We had gone astray from the path of God." Thus, they will testify against their own souls by confessing their disbelief.
37.tr: Faman azlamu mimma-nif taraa 'alal laahi kaziban aw kazzaba bi-Aayaatih; ulaaa'ika yanaa-luhum nasee-buhum minal Kitaab; hattaaa izaa jaaa'at-hum rusulunaa yatawaf-fawnahum qaalooo ai-na maa kuntum tad'oonaa min doonil laah(i); qaaloo dalloo 'annaa wa-shahidoo 'alaaa an-fusihim annahum kaanoo kaafireen

38.t: (On the Day of Judgment) the Lord will say to them, "Join the group of jinn and people who lived before you, in hell." Each group, on entering hell, will curse the other dwellers, until all of them are brought together therein. The last group will accuse the first saying, "Lord, they made us go astray. Therefore, double their torment in the Fire." The Lord will reply, "For everyone of you there is a double torment, but you do not know it".
38.tr: Qaalad khuloo feee uma-min qad khalat min qab-likum minal jinni wal-insi fin naar(i); kullamaa dakhalat ummatul la'anat ukhtaha; hattaaa izad daa-rakoo feehaa jamee'an qaalat ukh-raahum li-oolaa-hum Rabbanaa haaa-u'laaa'i adal-loonaa fa-aatihim 'azaaban di'fam minan naar(i); qaala likul-lin di'funw wa-laakil laa ta'lamoon

39.t: The first will then say, "You are no better than us; suffer the torment as the result of your deeds.
39.tr: Wa-qaalat oolaahum li-ukh-raahum famaa kaana lakum 'alainaa min fadlin fazoo-qul azaaba bimaa kuntum taksiboon

40.t: For those who have rejected Our revelations out of pride, no door to the heavens will be opened, nor will they be admitted into Paradise until a camel passes through the eye of a sewing needle. Thus do We recompense the criminals.
40.tr: Innal lazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa wastak-baroo 'anhaa laa tufat-tahu lahum abwaabus samaaa(i) wa-laa yad-khuloonal jannata hattaa yalijal jamalu fee sammil khiyaat; wa-kazaalika najzil mujrimeen

41.t: For them, hell will be both a cradle and a blanket. Thus do We punish the unjust.
41.tr: Lahum min jahannama mihaa-dunw wa-min faw-qihim ghawaash(i); wa-kazaalika najziz zaalimeen

42.t: The righteously striving believers - We do not impose on any soul that which is beyond its ability - are the dwellers of Paradise wherein they will live forever.
42.tr: Wal-lazeena aamanoo wa-'amilus saalihaati la nukallifu nafsan illaa wus'ahaaa ulaaa'ika As-haabul jannati, hum feehaa khaalidoon

43.t: We shall remove all grudges from their hearts. They will enjoy the flowing streams in the garden and will say, "God who guided us to this, deserves all praise. Had He not guided us, we would never have been able to find the right direction. The (angelic) Messengers of our Lord came to us with the Truth." They shall be told, 'This is the Paradise which you have inherited because of your good deeds."
43.tr: Wa-naza'naa maa fee sudoo-rihim min ghillin tajree min tah-ti-himul anhaar(u), wa-qaalul hamdu lil-laahil lazee hadaa-naa lihaaza wa-maa kunna linah-tadiya lau-laaa ann hadaanal laah(u), laqad jaaa'at Rusulu Rabbinaa bilhaqq; Wa-noodoo an til-kumul jannatu ooris-tumoohaa bimaa kuntum ta'maloon

44.t: The people of Paradise will say to the dwellers of the fire, "We have found whatever our Lord promised has come true. Have you found whatever the Lord promised you to be true?" They will reply, "Yes, we have also found it to be true." Thereupon, someone will cry out, "God has condemned the unjust,
44.tr: Wa-naadaa As-haabul jannati as-haaban naari an qad wajadnaa maa wa'ada-naa Rabbunaa haqqan fahal wajad-tum maa wa'ada Rabbukum haqqa(n); qaaloo na'am, fa-azzana mu'azzinum bainahum al la'natul laahi 'alaz zaalimeen

45.t: who prevented others from the way of God, sought to make (the path) appear crooked, and had no belief in the Day of Judgment."
45.tr: Allazeena yasud-doona 'an sabeelil laahi wa-yabghoo-nahaa 'iwaja(nw), Wa-hum bil-aakhirati kaafiroon

46.t: There will be a barrier between the people of Paradise and hell. There will be people on the heights who know everyone by their faces and who will say to the people of Paradise, "Peace be upon you." They hope to enter Paradise but are not yet therein.
46.tr: Wa-baina-humaa hijaab(unw), Wa-'alal A'raafi rijaa-luien ya'rifoona kullam bi-seemaahum; Wa-naadaw as-haabal jannati an salaamun 'alaikum; lam yad-khuloohaa wa-hum yatma'oon

47.t: When their eyes turn to the dwellers of hell, they will pray, "Lord, do not place us among the unjust."
47.tr: Wa-izaa surifat absaaruhum tilqaaa'a as-haabin naari qaaloo Rabbanaa laa taj'alnaa ma'al qawmiz zaalimeen

48.t: The people of the Heights will say to those (in hell) whose faces they recognize, "Why did your supporters and your pride not help you?"
48.tr: Wa-naadaaa as-haabul a'raafi rijaa-laien ya'rifoonahum bi-seemaahum qaaloo maaa aghnaa 'ankum jam'ukum wa-maa kuntum tastak-biroon

49.t: They will also say, "Are these (the people of Paradise) the ones of whom you swore would receive no mercy from God?" They will continue, " People of Paradise, live therein without any fear or grief."
49.tr: A-haaa'ulaaa'il lazeena aqsamtum laa yanaa-luhumul laahu bi-rahmah(tin); ud-khulul Jannata laa khawfun 'alaikum wa-laaa antum tah-zanoon

50.t: The dwellers of the fire will ask the people of Paradise to give them some water or other things which God has granted to them. They will reply, "God has deprived the unbelievers of the blessings of Paradise."
50.tr: Wa-naadaaa as-haabun naari as-haabal Jannati an afeedoo 'alainaa minal maaa'i aw mimma raza-qakumul laah(u); qaaloo innal laaha harrama-humaa 'alal kaafireen

51.t: On that Day We will neglect those who were deceived by the worldly life and who treated their religion as a useless game, because they had forgotten such a day and rejected Our revelations.
51.tr: Allazeenat takhazoo deenahum lahwanw Wa-la'i-banw Wa-gharrat-humul hayaatud dunyaa; fal-Yawma nannsaahum kamaa nasoo liqaaa'a Yawmihim haazaa Wa-maa kaanoo bi-aayaatinaa yajhadoon

52.t: We have revealed the Book of guidance and mercy to the believers and We know all of its details.
52.tr: Wa-laqad ji'naahum bi-Kitaabin fassalnaahu 'alaa 'ilmin hudanw Wa-rahmatal liqaw-mien yu'minoon

53.t: (Despite the clear details of Our guidance in the Book) do they still wait for further interpretations? On the Day (of Judgment) when its interpretations will be revealed, those who had ignored its guidance will confess, saying, "The Messengers of our Lord had certainly come to us with the Truth. Will anyone intercede for us or send us back (to life) so that we would be able to act in a different manner to that which we had done before?" These people have certainly lost their souls and their evil inventions (which they had used for false excuses) will vanish.
53.tr: Hal yanzuroona illaa ta'weelah(u); yawma ya'tee ta'wee-luhoo yaqoolul lazeena nasoohu min qablu qad jaaa'at Rusulu Rabbinaa bilhaqq; fahal lanaa min shufa'aaa'a fa-yashfa'oo lanaaa aw nuraddu fana'mala ghairal lazee kunnaa na'mal; qad khasirooo an-fusahum Wa-dalla 'anhum maa kaanoo yaftaroon

54.t: Your Lord is God who established His dominion over the Throne (of the realm) after having created the heavens and the earth in six days. He made the night darken the day which it pursues at a (considerable) speed and He made the sun and the moon submissive to His command. Is it not He Who creates and governs all things? Blessed is God, the Cherisher of the Universe.
54.tr: Inna Rabbakumul laahul lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal-arda fee sittati ayyaamin summas tawaa 'alal 'arshi yughshil lailan nahaara yatlu-buhoo haseesanw wash-shamsa wal-qamara wan-nujooma musakh-khaa-raatim bi-amrih(i); alaa lahul khalqu wal-amr(u); tabaarakal laahu Rabbul 'aalameen

55.t: Pray to your Lord humbly and privately. God does not love the transgressors.
55.tr: Ud'oo Rabbakum tadarru'anw Wa-khufyah(tan); innahoo laa yuhibbul mu'tadeen

56.t: Do not destroy the land after it has been well established but pray to God, have fear of Him, and hope to receive His mercy. God's mercy is close to the righteous people.
56.tr: Wa-laa tufsidoo fil ardi ba'da islaahihaa wad'oohu khawfanw Wa-tama'aa; inna rahmatal laahi qareebum minal muhsineen

57.t: God sends the wind bearing the glad news of His mercy. When heavy clouds are formed, We drive them unto a barren country and rain down on it water to cause all kinds of fruits to grow. In the same way do We bring the dead to life again. Perhaps you would take heed.
57.tr: Wa-Huwal lazee yursilur riyaaha bushram baina yadai rahmatihee hattaaa izaaa aqallat sahaaban siqaalan suqnaahu libaladim maiyitin fa-annzalnaa bihil maaa'a fa-akhrajnaa bihee minn kullis samaraat; kazaalika nukhrijul mawtaa la'allakum tazakkaroon

58.t: A good land produces plants, by the permission of its Lord, but a wicked land produces only miserable, bitter plants. Thus do We show a variety of evidence for those who give thanks.
58.tr: Walbaladut taiyibu yakhruju nabaatuhoo bi-izni Rabbihee wallazee khabusa laa yakhruju illaa nakidaa; kazaalika nusarriful Aayaati liqawminy yashkuroon

59.t: We sent Noah to his people. He told them, "Worship God for He is your only Lord. I am afraid of the punishment that you might suffer on the great Day (of Judgment)".
59.tr: Laqad arsalnaa noohan ilaa qawmihee faqaala yaa-qawmi' budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo inneee akhaafu 'alaikum 'azaaba Yawmin 'Azeem

60.t: A group of his people said to him, "You are absolutely wrong."
60.tr: Qaalal mala-u min qaw-miheee innaa lanaraaka fee dalaalim mubeen

61.t: (Noah) said, "My people, I am not in any error, rather I am a Messenger from the Lord of the Universe,
61.tr: Qaala yaa-qawmi laisa bee dalaalatunw Wa-laakinnee Rasoolum mir Rabbil 'aalameen

62.t: sent to preach to you the message of my Lord and to give you good advice. I know what you do not know about God.
62.tr: Uballighukum Risaalaati Rabbee Wa-ansahu lakum Wa-a'lamu minal laahi maa laa ta'lamoon

63.t: Does it seem strange to you that a reminder from your Lord should be sent to a man, from among you, to warn you so that you might receive mercy?"
63.tr: Awa'ajibtum an jaaa'akum zikrum mir Rabbikum 'alaa rajulim minkum liyunzirakum Wa-litattaqoo Wa-la'allakum turhamoon

64.t: They accused him of telling lies. So We saved him and his companions in an ark and drowned those who called Our revelations mere lies. They were, no doubt, a blind people.
64.tr: Fakazzaboohu fa-anjai-naahu wallazeena ma'ahoo fil fulki Wa-aghraqnal lazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa; innahum kaanoo qawman 'ameen

65.t: We sent Hud to his brethren, the tribe of `Ad, who told them, "Worship God for He is your only Lord. Will you not become pious?"
65.tr: Wa-ilaa 'aadin akhaahum Hoodaa; qaala yaa-qawmi' budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuh; afalaa tattaqoon

66.t: A group of the unbelievers among his people said, "You look to us like a fool and we think that you are a liar".
66.tr: Qaalal mala-ul lazeena kafaroo min qawmiheee innaa lanaraaka fee safaahatinw Wa-innaa la-nazunnuka minal kaazibeen

67.t: He replied, "My people, I am not a fool but a Messenger of the Lord of the Universe.
67.tr: Qaala yaa-qawmi laisa bee safaahatunw Wa-laakinnee Rasoolum mir Rabbil 'aalameen

68.t: I preach the message of my Lord to you and am a trustworthy advisor for you.
68.tr: Uballighukum Risaalaati Rabbee Wa-ana lakum naasihun ameen

69.t: Does it seem strange to you that a reminder from your Lord should be sent to a man among you so that He may warn you? Recall when God appointed you as successors of the people of Noah and increased your power over other people. Give thanks to God for His blessings so that perhaps you will have everlasting happiness."
69.tr: Awa'ajibtum an jaaa'akum zikrum mir Rabbikum 'alaa rajulim minkum liyunzirakum; wazkurooo iz ja'alakum khulafaaa'a mim ba'di qawmi noohinw Wa-zaadakum fil khalqi bastatan fazkurooo aalaaa'al laahi la'allakum tuflihoon

70.t: They said, "Have you come to make us worship God alone and give up what our fathers worshipped? If you are truthful, let the torment with which you have threatened us, strike us".
70.tr: Qaalooo aji'tanaa lina'budal laaha wahdahoo Wa-nazara maa kaana ya'budu aabaaa'unaa fa'tinaa bimaa ta'idunaaa in kunta minas saadiqeen

71.t: He replied, "You will certainly be afflicted by wickedness and the wrath of God. Do you dispute with me about the names of that which you and your fathers have invented? God has given no authority to those names. Wait for God's decree and I, too, am waiting with you."
71.tr: Qaala qad waqa'a alaikum mir Rabbikum rijsunw Wa-ghadab, atujaadiloonanee feee asmaaa'in sammaitumoohaaa antum Wa-aabaaa'ukum maa nazzalal laahu bihaa min sultaan; fantazirooo innee ma'akum minal muntazireen

72.t: Through Our mercy, We saved him and his companions and destroyed the unbelievers who called Our revelations mere lies.
72.tr: Fa-anjainaahu wallazeena ma'ahoo birahmatim minnaa Wa-qata'naa daabiral lazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-maa kaanoo mu'mineen

73.t: We sent Salih to his brethren, the tribe of Thamud, who told them, "Worship God your only Lord. Authoritative evidence has come to you from your Lord and this she-camel is the evidence for you from God. Let her graze in the land of God. Do not give her any trouble lest a painful torment will strike you.
73.tr: Wa-ilaa Samooda akhaahum Saalihaa; qaala yaa-qawmi' budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo qad jaaa'atkum baiyinatum mir Rabbikum haazihee naaqatul laahi lakum Aayatan fazaroohaa ta'kul feee ardil laahi Wa-laa tamassoohaa bisooo'in fa-ya'khuzakum 'azaabun aleem

74.t: Recall (the time) when We settled you in the land as the heirs of the tribe of Ad and how you established mansions in the plains and carved homes out of the mountains. Give thanks to God for His favors and do not commit evil in the land."
74.tr: Wazkuroo iz ja'alakum khulafaaa'a mim ba'di 'Aadinw Wa-bawwa-akum fil ardi tattakhizoona min suhoolihaa qusooranw Wa-tanhitoonal jibaala buyootan fazkurooo aalaaa'al laahi Wa-laa ta'saw fil ardi mufsideen

75.t: The proud ones among Salih's people asked his oppressed followers, "Do you (really) know that Salih is a Messenger of his Lord?" They replied, "We have faith in the Message which he preaches".
75.tr: Qaalal mala-ul lazeenas takbaroo min qawmihee lillazeenas tud'ifoo liman aamana minhum ata'lamoona anna Saaliham mursalum mir Rabbih; qaalooo innaa bimaaa ursila bihee mu'minoon

76.t: The proud oppressors said, "We reject that which you believe in".
76.tr: Qaalal lazeenas takbarooo innaa billazeee aamanntum bihee kaafiroon

77.t: They then slew the camel and rebelled against the orders of their Lord saying, " Salih, if you are truly a Messenger, let that torment with which you have threatened us come to pass."
77.tr: Fa'aqarun naaqata wa'ataw 'an amri Rabbihim Wa-qaaloo yaa-Saalihu' tinaa bimaa ta'idunaaa in kunta minal mursaleen

78.t: Suddenly, an earthquake jolted them and they were left motionless in their homes.
78.tr: Fa-akhazat-humur rajfatu fa-asbahoo fee daarihim jaasimeen

79.t: He turned away from them saying, "My people, I preached the Message of my Lord to you and gave you good advice, but you do not love advisors."
79.tr: Fa-tawalla 'anhum Wa-qaala yaa-qawmi laqad ablaghtukum Risaalata Rabbee Wa-nasahtu lakum Wa-laakil laa tuhibboonan naasiheen

80.t: Lot told his people, "Why do you commit such indecent acts that have never been committed by anyone before?
80.tr: Wa-Lootan iz qaala liqawmiheee ata'toonal faahishata maa sabaqakum bihaa min ahadim minal 'aalameen

81.t: You engage in lustful activities with people instead of women. You have become transgressing people.
81.tr: Innakum lata'toonar rijaala shahwatam min doonin nisaaa'; bal antum qawmum musrifoon

82.t: His people had no answer to his remarks but to tell one another, "Expel him from our town; he and his people want to purify themselves."
82.tr: Wa-maa kaana jawaaba qawmihee illaa an qaalooo akhrijoohum min qaryatikum innahum unaasuny yatatahharoon

83.t: We saved (Lot) and his family except his wife who remained with the rest.
83.tr: Fa-anjainaahu Wa-ahlahooo illam ra-atahoo kaanat minal ghaabireen

84.t: We sent a torrential rain unto the (unbelievers). Consider how disastrous the end of the criminals was!
84.tr: Wa-'amtarnaa 'alaihim mataran fanzur kaifa kaana aaqibatul mujrimeen

85.t: We sent to the people of Midian their brother Shu'ayb who also told his people to worship God their only Lord. He said, "A guidance has come to you from your Lord. Maintain proper measures and weights in trade. Do not cause any deficiency in people's property or destroy the land after it has been reformed. This is for your own good, if you have any faith.
85.tr: Wa-ilaa Madyana akhaahum Shu'aybaa; qaala yaa-qawmi' budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo qad jaaa'atkum baiyinatum mir Rabbikum fa-awful kaila walmeezaana Wa-laa tabkhasun naasa ashyaa'ahum Wa-laa tufsidoo fil ardi ba'da islaahihaa; zaalikum khairul lakum in kuntum mu'mineen

86.t: Do not ambush the believers or hinder them from every path that leads them to God just because you wish to make such ways seem crooked. Recall the time when you were just a few in number and God multiplied you. Consider how terrible the end of the evil-doers was!
86.tr: Wa-laa taq'udoo bikulli siraatin too'idoona Wa-tasuddoona 'an sabeelil laahi man aamana bihee Wa-tabghoonahaa 'iwajaa; waz-kurooo iz kuntum qaleelan fakassarakum wanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mufsideen

87.t: If there are some of you who believe in the Message that I have been commanded to preach and there are others who do not, exercise patience until God judges among us. He is the best Judge."
87.tr: Wa-In kaana taaa'ifatum minkum aamanoo billazeee ursiltu bihee Wa-taaa'ifatul lam yu'minoo fasbiroo hattaa yahkumal laahu bainanaa; Wa-Huwa khairul haakimeen

88.t: A proud group among Shu'ayb's people said, "We must expel you (Shu'ayb) and your followers from our town unless you give-up your faith and live as our own people." Shu'ayb asked them, "Will you use force against us?
88.tr: Qaalal mala-ul lazeenas takbaroo min qawmihee lanukhrijannaka yaa-Shu'aibu wallazeena aamanoo ma'aka min qaryatinaaa aw lata'oo-dunna fee millatinaa; qaala awa-law kunnaa kaariheen

89.t: We would certainly be inventing falsehoods against God if we were to accept your way of life, when God has already saved us from it. We do not have to accept it unless God, our Lord, wills it. Our Lord's knowledge covers all things. We trust in Him and ask Him to judge among us and our people, for He is the best Judge."
89.tr: Qadif tarainaa 'alal laahi kaziban in 'udnaa fee millatikum ba'da iz najjaanal laahu minhaa; Wa-maa yakoonu lanaaa an na'ooda feehaaa illaaa ai yashaaa'al laahu Rabbunaa; wasi'a Rabbunaa kulla shai'in 'ilmaa; 'alal laahi tawakkalnaa; Rabbanaf tah bainanaa Wa-baina qawminaa bilhaqqi Wa-Anta khairul faatiheen

90.t: A group of the unbelievers among his people told the others, "If you follow Shu'ayb, you will certainly lose a great deal."
90.tr: Wa-qaalal mala-ul lazeena kafaroo min qawmihee la'init taba'tum Shu'aiban innakum izal lakhaasiroon

91.t: Suddenly, an earthquake struck them and left them motionless in their homes.
91.tr: Fa-akhazat-humur rajfatu fa-asbahoo fee daarihim jaasimeen

92.t: Those who called Shu'ayb a liar were destroyed as though they never existed. They certainly were the ones to lose a great deal.
92.tr: Allazeena kazzaboo Shu'aiban ka-al lam yaghnaw feehaa; allazeena kazzaboo Shu'aiban kaanoo humul khaasireen

93.t: He turned away from them saying, "My people, I preached the Message of my Lord to you and gave you good advice. How could I be sorry for the unbelievers?"
93.tr: Fatawalla 'anhum Wa-qaala yaa-qawmi laqad ablaghtukum Risaalaati Rabbee Wa-nasahtu lakum fakaifa aasaa 'alaa qawmin kaafireen

94.t: To every town that We sent a Prophet, We tested its inhabitants through distress and adversity so that perhaps they would submit themselves to Us.
94.tr: Wa-maaa arsalnaa fee qaryatim min Nabiyyin illaaa akhaznaaa ahlahaa bil-ba'saaa'i waddarraaa'i la'allahum yaddarra'oon

95.t: We then replaced their misfortune with well-being until they were relieved and began saying, "Our fathers had also experienced good and bad days." Suddenly, We struck them (with torment) while they were all unaware (of what was happening).
95.tr: Summa baddalnaa makaa-nas saiyi'atil hasanata hattaa 'afaw Wa-qaaloo qad massa aabaa'anad darraaa'u wassarraaa'u fa-akhaznaahum baghtatanw Wa-hum laa yash'uroon

96.t: Had the people of the towns believed (in Our revelations) and maintained piety, We would have certainly showered on them Our blessings from the sky and the earth. But they called Our revelations lies, thus Our torment struck them for their evil deeds.
96.tr: Wa-law anna ahlal quraaa aamanoo wattaqaw lafatahnaa 'alaihim barakaatim minas samaaa'i wal-ardi Wa-laakin kazzaboo fa-akhaznaahum bimaa kaanoo yaksiboon

97.t: Did the people of the towns think themselves secure from Our wrath that could strike them at night during their sleep
97.tr: Afa-amina ahlul quraaa ai ya'tiyahum ba'sunaa bayaatanw Wa-hum naaa'imoon

98.t: or that which could seize them during their busy hours of the day?
98.tr: Awa-amina ahlul quraaa ai ya'tiyahum ba'sunaa duhanw Wa-hum yal'aboon

99.t: Did they consider themselves secure from the retribution of God? No one can have such attitude except those who are lost.
99.tr: Afa-aminoo makral laah; falaa ya'manu makral laahi illal qawmul khaasiroon

100.t: Is it not a lesson for the successors of the past generations that had We wanted, We could have punished them for their sins, sealed their hearts and deprived them of hearing?
100.tr: Awa-lam yahdi lillazeena yarisoonal arda mim ba'di ahlihaaa al law nashaaa'u asabnaahum bizunoobihim; Wa-natba'u 'alaa quloobihim fahum laa yasma'oon

101.t: (Muhammad), such were the stories of the people who lived in (different) towns in the past. We had sent Our Messengers to them with (certain) miracles but the people still did not believe in what they had rejected before. Such is how God seals the hearts of the unbelievers.
101.tr: Tilkal quraa naqussu 'alaika min ambaaa'ihaa; Wa-laqad jaaa'at-hum Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati famaa kaanoo liyu'minoo bimaa kazzaboo min qabl; kazaalika yatba'ul laahu 'alaa quloobil kaafireen

102.t: We did not find many among them keeping their promises. However, We did find many evil-doers among them.
102.tr: Wa-maa wajadnaa li-aksarihim min 'ahd; Wa-inw wajadnaaa aksarahum lafaasiqeen

103.t: After the time of those people, We sent Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his people, but they too rejected Our miracles. Consider, how terrible the end of the evil-doers is!
103.tr: Summa ba'asnaa mim ba'dihim Moosaa bi-Aayaatinaaa ilaa Fir'awana Wa-mala'ihee fazalamoo bihaa fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mufsideen

104.t: Moses told the Pharaoh, "I am a Messengers from the Lord of the Universe.
104.tr: Wa-qaala Moosaa yaa-Fir'awnu inneee Rasoolum mir Rabbil 'aalameen

105.t: I must only speak what is true about God. I have brought you miracles from your Lord; therefore, let the children of Israel go free".
105.tr: Haqeequn 'alaaa al laaa aqoola 'alal laahi illal haqq; qad ji'tukum bibaiyinatim mir Rabbikum fa-arsil ma'iya Baneee Israaa'eel

106.t: The Pharaoh asked Moses to show his miracles if he was telling the truth.
106.tr: Qaala in kunnta ji'ta bi-Aayatin fa'ti bihaa in kunnta minas saadiqeen

107.t: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it turned into a real serpent.

108.t: Then he uncovered his hand and it appeared sheer white to the onlookers.
108.tr: Wa-naza'a yadahoo fa-izaa hiya baidaaa'u linnaazireen

109.t: Some of the Pharaoh's nobles considered him to be no more than a skillful magician
109.tr: Qaalal mala-u min qawmi Fir'awna inna haazaa lasaahirun 'aleem

110.t: and said, "He wants to expel you from your land." They asked (others), " what is your opinion in the matter?
110.tr: Yureedu ai yukhrijakum min ardikum famaazaa ta'muroon

111.t: The others suggested holding Moses and his brother off and sending to all the cities
111.tr: Qaalooo arjih Wa-akhaahu Wa-arsil fil madaaa'ini haashireen

112.t: to bring together at the Pharaohs court all the skillful magicians.

113.t: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said, "We must have our reward if we are to gain a victory over him (Moses)".
113.tr: Wa-jaaa'as saharatu Fir'awna qaaloo inna lanaa la-ajjran in kunnaa nahnul ghaalibeen

114.t: The Pharaoh replied, "In addition to your rewards, you will become my close friends thereafter."

115.t: The magicians asked Moses, "Will you throw your staff first or shall we?"
115.tr: Qaaloo yaa-Moosaaa immaaa an tulqiya Wa-immaaa an nakoona nahnul mulqeen

116.t: He replied, "Throw yours first." Their great magic bewitched people's eyes and terrified them.
116.tr: Qaala alqoo falam-maaa alqaw saharooo a'yunan naasi wastarhaboohum Wa-jaaa'oo bisihrin 'azeem

117.t: We inspired Moses to throw his staff, and suddenly it began to swallow-up all that the magicians had (falsely) invented.
117.tr: Wa-awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa an alqi 'asaaka fa-izaa hiya talqafu maa ya'fikoon

118.t: Thus the Truth prevailed and their false art was banished.
118.tr: Fawaqa'al haqqu Wa-batala maa kaanoo ya'maloon

119.t: The magicians who were defeated on the spot and were proved to be worthless,

121.t: saying, "We declare our belief in the Lord of the Universe,

122.t: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

123.t: The Pharaoh said to the magicians, "You declared your belief in him (Moses) without my permission. This is a plot to throw my people out of their city. But you will soon know.
123.tr: Qaala Fir'awnu aamantum bihee qabla an aazana lakum; inna haaza lamakrum makartumoohu fil madeenati litukhrijoo minhaaa ahlahaa fasawfa ta'lamoon

124.t: I will cut off your hands and feet on the alternate sides and crucify you all."
124.tr: La-uqatti'anna aidiyakum Wa-arjulakum min khilaafin summa la-usallibannakum ajma'een

125.t: The magicians said, "We will certainly return to Our Lord.

126.t: You only take revenge on us because we believed in the Lord when we saw His miracles. Lord, grant us patience and let us die Muslims (submitted to God)."
126.tr: Wa-maa tanqimu minnaaa illaaa an aamannaa bi-Aayaati Rabbinaa lammaa jaaa'atnaa; Rabbanaaa afrigh 'alainaa sabranw Wa-tawaffanaa muslimeen

127.t: Some of the Pharaohs people said, "Will you let Moses and his people destroy the land and disregard you and your gods?" The Pharaoh said, "We will kill their sons and leave their women alive; they are under our domination."
127.tr: Wa-qaalal mala-u min qawmi Fir'awna atazaru Moosaa Wa-qawmahoo liyufsidoo fil ardi Wa-yazaraka Wa-aalihatak; qaala sanuqattilu abnaaa'ahum Wa-nastahyee nisaaa'ahum Wa-innaa fawqahum qaahiroon

128.t: Moses told his people to seek help from God and exercise patience. The earth belongs to Him and He has made it the heritage of whichever of His servants He chooses. The final victory is for the pious ones.
128.tr: Qaala Moosaa liqawmihis ta'eenoo billaahi wasbiroo innal arda lillaahi yoorisuhaa mai yashaaa'u min 'ibaadihee wal-'aaqibatu lilmuttaqeen

129.t: His people said, "We suffered a great deal before you came and we are still suffering even after you have come." Moses (tried to encourage them) by saying, "There is hope that your Lord will destroy your enemies and make you (their) successors in the land. So consider how you act."
129.tr: Qaaloo oozeenaa min qabli an ta'tiyanaa Wa-mim ba'di maa ji'tanaa; qaala 'asaa Rabbukum ai yuhlika 'aduwwakum Wa-yastakhli-fakum fil ardi fayanzura kaifa ta'maloon

130.t: For years We afflicted Pharaoh's people with shortages in food so that perhaps they would take heed.
130.tr: Wa-laqad akhaznaaa Aala Fir'awna bis-sineena Wa-naqsim minas samaraati la'allahum yazzakkaroon

131.t: But they would always ascribe their well-being to themselves and the misfortunes that they would experience to Moses and his people. Their fate is certainly in the hands of God but many of them do not know.
131.tr: Fa-izaa jaaa'at-humul hasanatu qaaloo lanaa haazihee Wa-in tusibhum saiyi'atuny yattaiyaroo bi-Moosaa Wa-mam ma'ah; alaaa innamaa taaa'iruhum 'indal laahi Wa-laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon

132.t: They said to Moses, "No matter what miracle you show to bewitch us, we will not believe you."
132.tr: Wa-qaaloo mahmaa taatinaa bihee min Aayatil litas'haranaa bihaa famaa nahnu laka bimu'mineen

133.t: We sent upon them widespread calamities: floods of locusts, lice, frogs, and blood. All were distinct miracles but these criminals all the time remained proud.
133.tr: Fa-arsalnaa 'alaihimut toofaana waljaraada walqum-mala waddafaadi'a waddama Aayaatim mufassalaatin fastakbaroo Wa-kaanoo qawmam mujrimeen

134.t: When the torment would strike them, they would ask Moses, "Pray for us to your Lord through your covenant with Him. If He saves us from the torment, we shall certainly believe in you and permit you and the children of Israel to leave".
134.tr: Wa-lammaa waqa'a 'alaihimur rijzu qaaloo ya-Moosad-u lanaa rabbaka bimaa 'ahida 'indaka la'in kashafta 'annar rijza lanu 'minanna laka Wa-lanursilanna ma'aka Banee Israaa'eel

135.t: But when We relieved them from the torment for a given time, they again broke their promise.
135.tr: Falammaa kashafnaa 'anhumur rijza ilaaa ajalin hum baalighoohu izaa hum yankusoon

136.t: We took revenge on them for their rejecting Our miracles, by drowning them in the sea, but they were not aware of (reality).
136.tr: Fantaqamnaa minhum fa'aghraqnaahum Fil' yammi bi-Annahum kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-kaanoo 'anhaa ghaafileen

137.t: We gave the suppressed people the blessed eastern and western regions as their inheritance. Thus, the promises of your Lord to the children of Israel all came true because of the patience which they exercised. He destroyed all the establishments of the Pharaoh and his people.
137.tr: Wa-awrasnal qawmal lazeena kaanoo yustad'afoona mashaariqal ardi Wa-maghaari-bahal latee baaraknaa feehaa Wa-tammat kalimatu Rabbikal husnaa 'alaa Baneee Israaa'eela bimaa sabaroo Wa-dammarnaa maa kaana yasna'u Fir'awnu Wa-qawmuhoo Wa-maa kaanoo ya'rishoon

138.t: We helped the children of Israel to cross the sea. They came to a people who worshipped idols. The Israelites demanded Moses to make gods for them like those of the idol-worshippers. Moses told them, "You are an ignorant people.
138.tr: Wa-jaawaznaa bi-Banneee Israaa'eelal bahra fa-ataw 'alaa qawminy ya'kufoona 'alaaa asnaamil lahum; qaaloo yaa-Moosaj 'al lanaa ilaahan kamaa lahum aalihah; qaala innakum qawmun tajhaloon

139.t: What these people worship is doomed to be destroyed and their deeds are based on falsehood.
139.tr: Innaa haaa'ulaaa'i mutabbarum maa hum feehi Wa-baatilum maa kaanoo ya'maloon

140.t: Should I choose for you a lord other than God who has favored you above all other people?
140.tr: Qaala a-ghairal laahi abgheekum ilaahanw Wa-Huwa faddalakum 'alal 'aalameen

141.t: "Children of Israel, when I saved you from the Pharaoh and his people who made you suffer the worst kinds of torment, killing your sons and keeping your women alive, it was a great trial for you from your Lord."
141.tr: Wa-iz anjainaakum min Aali Fir'awna yasoomoo-nakum sooo'al 'azaab, yuqattiloona abnaaa'akum Wa-yastahyoona nisaaa'akum; Wa-fee zaalikum balaaa'um mir Rabbikum 'azeem

142.t: We told Moses to stay with Us for thirty nights (in the mountains) but added ten nights more so his appointment with his Lord came to an end after forty nights. Moses had appointed his brother Aaron as his deputy among his people during his absence saying, "Try to reform them and do not follow the way of the evil-doers."
142.tr: Wa-waa'adnaa Moosaa salaaseena lailatanw Wa-at-mamnaahaa bi'ashrim fatamma meeqaatu Rabbihee arba'eena lailah; Wa-qaala Moosaa liakheehi Haaroonakh lufnee fee qawmee Wa-aslih Wa-laa tattabi' sabeelal mufsideen

143.t: During the appointment, the Lord spoke to Moses. He asked the Lord to show Himself so that he could look at Him. The Lord replied, "You can never see Me. But look at the mountain. If the mountain remains firm only then will you see Me." When the Lord manifested His Glory to the mountain, He turned it into dust and Moses fell down upon his face senseless. After regaining his senses, Moses said, "Lord, You are all Holy. I repent for what I asked you to do and I am the first to believe in You."
143.tr: Wa-lammaa jaaa'a Moosa limeeqaatinaa Wa-kallamahoo Rabbuhoo qaala Rabbi arineee anzur ilaik; qaala lan taraanee Wa-laakinin zur ilal jabali fa-inis taqarra makaanahoo fasawfa taraanee; falammaa tajallaa Rabbuhoo liljabali ja'alahoo dakkanw Wa-kharra Moosaa sa'iqaa; falammaaa afaaqa qaala Subhaanaka tubtu ilaika Wa-ana awwalul mu'mineen

144.t: The Lord said to Moses, "I have given you distinction above the people by speaking to you and giving you My Message. Receive what I have given to you and give Us thanks."
144.tr: Qaala yaa-Moosaaa innis tafaituka 'alan naasi bi-Risaalaatee Wa-bi-kalaamee fakhuz maaa aataituka Wa-kum minash shaakireen

145.t: We wrote advice and laws for him on Tablets about all kinds of things, saying, "Follow them and command your people to follow the good advice therein, and I will show you the dwellings of the evil-doers."
145.tr: Wa-katabnaa lahoo fil alwaahi min kulli shai'im maw'izaanw Wa-tafseelal likulli shai'in fakhuzhaa biquwwatinw wa'mur qawmaka ya'khuzoo bi-ahsanihaa; sa'ooreekum daaral faasiqeen

146.t: We will deprive those who are wrongly proud in the land of the blessing of revelations. Even if they would see all kinds of miracles, they would not have faith, or even to see the right path, they would not follow it. They would follow the rebellious way if they were to find one; in their ignorance, they have called Our revelations mere lies.
146.tr: Sa-asrifu 'an Aayaatiyal lazeena yatakabbaroona fil ardi bighairil haqq; Wa-iny yaraw kulla Aayatil laa yu'minoo bihaa Wa-iny yaraw sabeelar rushdi laa yattakhizoohu sabeelanw Wa-iny yaraw sabeelal ghaiyi yattakhizoohu sabeelaa; zaalika bi-annahum kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-kaanoo 'anhaa ghaafileen

147.t: The deeds of those who have called Our revelations and belief in the Day of Judgment mere lies, will be turned devoid of all virtue. Can they expect to receive a reward for their deeds other than that which is the result of their deeds?
147.tr: Wallazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-liqaaa'il Aakhirati habitat 'amaaluhum; hal yujzawna illaa maa kaanoo ya'maloon

148.t: In Moses' absence, his people manufactured a hollow sounding calf out of their ornaments. Could they not see that it could not speak to them or provide them with any guidance? They gained only evil by worshipping the calf.
148.tr: Wattakhaza qawmu Moosaa mim ba'dihee min huliyyihim 'ijlan jasadal lahoo khuwaar; alam yaraw annahoo laa yukallimuhum Wa-laa yahdeehim sabeelaa; ittakhazoohu Wa-kaanoo zaalimeen

149.t: When they found that they had believed in the wrong thing, they regretfully said, "If our Lord will not have mercy on us and forgive us, we will certainly be lost."
149.tr: Wa-lammaa suqita feee aideehim Wa-ra aw-annahum qad dalloo qaaloo la'il lam yarhamnaa Rabbunaa Wa-yaghfir lanaa lanakoonanna minal khaasireen

150.t: When Moses returned to his people with anger and sorrow, he said, "What you have done in my absence is certainly evil. Why were you hasty about the commandments of your Lord?" He threw away the Tablets (which contained the commandments of God), grabbed his brother and started to pull him to himself. His brother begged him saying, "Son of my mother, the people suppressed me and almost killed me. Do not humiliate me before the enemies or call me unjust".
150.tr: Wa-lammaa raja'a Moosaaa ilaa qawmihee ghadbaana asifan qaala bi'samaa khalaftumoonee min ba'dee 'a-'ajiltum amra Rabbikum Wa-alqal alwaaha Wa-akhaza bira'si akheehi yajurruhoo ilaiyh; qaalab na umma innal qawmas tad'afoonee Wa-kadoo yaqtu-loonanee; falaa tushmit biyal a'daaa'a Wa-laa taj'alnee ma'al qawmiz zaalimeen

151.t: Moses prayed, "Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy; you are the most Merciful."
151.tr: Qaala Rabbigh fir lee Wa-li-akhee Wa-adkhilnaa fee rahmatika Wa-Anta arhamur raahimeen

152.t: (The Lord said), "Those who worshipped the calf will be afflicted by the wrath of their Lord and disgraced in their worldly life. Thus, We will recompense those who invent falsehood.
152.tr: Innal lazeenat takhazul 'ijla-sa yanaaluhum ghadabum mir Rabbihim Wa-zillatun fil hayaatid dunyaa; Wa-kazaalika najzil muftareen

153.t: To those who commit bad deeds, but, then, repent and believe (in God), Your Lord will certainly be All-forgiving and All-merciful."
153.tr: Wallazeena 'amilus saiyiaati summa taaboo min ba'dihaa Wa-aamanooo inna Rabbaka min ba'dihaa la-Ghafoorur Raheem

154.t: When Moses' anger calmed down, he collected the Tablets. On one of them was written, "God's mercy and guidance are for those who have fear of Him."
154.tr: Wa-lammaa sakata 'an Moosal ghadabu akhazal alwaaha Wa-fee nuskhatihaa hudanw Wa-rahmatul lil-lazeena hum li-Rabbihim yarhaboon

155.t: Moses selected seventy men from his people to attend Our appointment. (In Our presence). When an earthquake jolted them to death, Moses said, "Lord, had You wanted to destroy them, why did You not destroy them and me before. Are You destroying us for what the fools among us have done? This (destruction) is only a trial through which You cause some to go astray and guide others. You are our Guardian. Forgive us and have mercy on us; You are the best of those who forgive.
155.tr: Wakhtaara Moosaa qawmahoo sab'eena rajulal li-meeqaatinaa falammaa akhazat-humur rajfatu qaala Rabbi law shi'ta ahlaktahum min qablu Wa-iyyaay; 'a-tuhlikuna bimaa fa'alas sufahaaa'u minaa in hiya illaa fitnatuka tudillu bihaa man tashaaa'u Wa-tahdee man tashaaa; Anta waliyyunaa faghfir lanaa warhamnaa Wa-Anta khairul ghaafireen

156.t: "Grant us well-being in this life and in the life hereafter for we have turned ourselves to You." The Lord replied, "My torment only afflicts those whom I want to punish, but My mercy encompasses all things. I shall grant mercy to those who maintain piety, pay their religious tax, and those who have faith in Our revelations."
156.tr: Waktub lanaa fee haazi-hid dunyaa hasanatanw Wa-fil Aakhirati innaa hudnaaa ilaik; qaala 'azaabee useebu bihee man ashaaa'u Wa-rahmatee wasi'at kulla shai'; fasa-aktubuhaa lil-lazeena yattaqoona Wa-yu'toonaz Zakaata wal-lazeena hum bi-Aayaatinaa yu'minoon

157.t: There are those who follow the Messengers, the illiterate Prophet (not conventionally educated), whose description they find written in the Torah and the Gospel. [He (the Messengers) enjoins them to do good and forbids them to do all that is unlawful, makes lawful for them all that is pure and unlawful all that is filthy, removes their burdens and the entanglements in which they are involved]. Those who believe in him, honor and help him, and follow the light which is sent down to him, will have everlasting happiness.
157.tr: Allazeena yattabi'oonar Rasoolan Nabiyyal ummiyyal lazee yajidoonahoo maktooban 'indahum fit Tawraati wal-Injeeli ya'muruhum bilma'roofi Wa-yanhaahum 'anil munkari Wa-yuhillu lahumul taiyibaati Wa-yuharrimu 'alaihimul khabaaa'isa Wa-yada'u 'anhum israhum wal-aghlaalal latee kaanat 'alaihim; fallazeena aamanoo bihee Wa-'azzaroohu Wa-nasaroohu wattaba'un nooral lazeee unzila ma'ahooo ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon

158.t: (Muhammad), tell them, "People, I have come to you all as the Messengers of God, to whom the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs. There is no God but He. In His hands are life and death. Have faith in God and His Messengers, the unlettered Prophet who believes in God and His words. Follow him so that you will perhaps have guidance."
158.tr: Qul yaaa-aiyuhan naasu innee Rasoolul laahi ilaikum jamee'anil lazee lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal-ardi laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa yuhyee Wa-yumeetu fa-aaminoo billaahi Wa-Rasoolihin Nabiyyil ummiy-yil lazee yu'minu billaahi Wa-Kalimaatihee wattabi'oohu la'allakum tahtadoon

159.t: Among the people of Moses are some whose guidance and Judgment are based on the Truth.
159.tr: Wa-min qawmi Moosaaa ummatuny yahdoona bilhaqqi Wa-bihee ya'diloon

160.t: We divided the descendants of Israel into twelve tribes and told Moses to strike the rock with his staff to let twelve fountains gush out therefrom; his people had asked him to supply them with water. The twelve flowing springs were divided among them (a spring for each tribe) and each tribe knew its drinking place well. We provided them with shade from the clouds, sent down manna and quails to them for food, and told them to eat the pure things which We had given them. They did not do injustice to Us but they wronged themselves.
160.tr: Wa-qatta'naahumus natai 'ashrata asbaatan umamaa; Wa-awhainaa ilaa Moosaaa izis tasqaahu qawmuhooo anid rib bi'asaakal hajara fambajasat minhus nata 'ashrata 'ainan qad 'alima kullu unaasim mashrabahum; Wa-zallalnaa 'alaihimul ghamaama Wa-anzalnaa 'alaihimul manna was-Salwaa kuloo min taiyibaati maa razaqnaakum; Wa-maa zalamoonaa Wa-laakin kaanooo anfusahum yazlimoon

161.t: When they were told, "Settle down in this town, eat as you wish, seek forgiveness and enter the gate prostrating yourselves (in obedience to the Lord) and We will forgive you your sins and increase the reward of the righteous people,
161.tr: Wa-iz qeela lahumus kunoo haazihil qaryata Wa-kuloo minhaa haisu shi'tum Wa-qooloo hittatunw wadkhulul baaba sujjadan naghfir lakum khateee'aatikum; sanazeedul muhsineen

162.t: the unjust among them changed the words which they were told to say (in the prayer). Therefore, We sent upon them torment from the sky for their wrong deeds.
162.tr: Fabaddalal lazeena zalamoo minhum qawlan ghairal lazee qeela lahum fa-arsalnaa 'alaihim rijzan minas samaaa'i bimaa kaanoo yazlimoon

163.t: (Muhammad), ask them about the (people of the) towns on the seashore. They had transgressed by catching fish on the Sabbath. Each Sabbath the fish came openly within their reach but not so on other days. Thus, We were testing them because of their evil deeds.
163.tr: Was'alhum 'anil qaryatil latee kaanat haadiratal bahri iz ya'doona fis Sabti iz ta'teehim heetaanuhum yawma Sabtihim shurra'anw Wa-yawma laa yasbitoona laa ta'teehim; kazaalika nabloohum bimaa kaanoo yafsuqoon

164.t: When a group of them questioned another group saying, "Why do you preach to those whom God has decided to destroy or punish by a severe torment?" they replied, "We preach to them for we are responsible in the sight of your Lord and so that perhaps they may have fear of God."
164.tr: Wa-iz qaalat ummatum minhum lima ta'izoona qaw-manil laahu muhlikuhum aw mu'azzibuhum 'azaaban shadeedan qaaloo ma'ziratan ilaa Rabbikum Wa-la'allahum yattaqoon

165.t: When they (the unjust people) forgot what was preached to them, We saved the preachers from evil and afflicted the unjust for their evil deeds, with a dreadful torment.
165.tr: Falammaa nasoo maa zukkiroo bihee anjainal lazeena yanhawna 'anis sooo'i Wa-akhaznal lazeena zalamoo bi'azaabim ba'eesim bimaa kaanoo yafsuqoon

166.t: When they crossed the limit of the prohibition, We made them turn into detested apes.
166.tr: Falammaa 'ataw 'am maa nuhoo 'anhu qulna lahum koonoo qiradatan khaasi'een

167.t: (Muhammad), consider, when your Lord declared to the (Israelites) His decision to raise a people above them who would make them suffer the worst kinds of torments until the Day of Judgment. Certainly your Lord's retribution is swift. He is All-forgiving and All-merciful.
167.tr: Wa-iz ta-azzana Rabbuka la-yab'asannna 'alaihim ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati mai yasoomuhum sooo'al 'azaab; inna Rabbaka lasaree'ul 'iqaabi Wa-innahoo la-Ghafoorur Raheem

168.t: We divided them into nations on the earth; some are righteous and others are not. We tested them with well-being and hardship so that they might return (to the right path).
168.tr: Wa-qatta'naahum fil ardi umaman min-humus saalihoona Wa-min-hum doona zaalika Wa-balawnaahum bil-hasanaati was-saiyi'aati la'allahum yarji'oon

169.t: Their descendants who inherited the Book gained (by bribery only) worthless things from the worldly life saying, "We shall be forgiven (for what we have done). They would have even doubled such gains if they could have received more. Did they not make a covenant (with God) in the Book not to speak any thing other than the Truth about God and to study its contents well? The life hereafter is much better for the pious ones. Will you not then think?
169.tr: Fakhalafa min ba'dihim khalfunw warisul Kitaaba ya'khuzoona 'arada haazal adnaa Wa-yaqooloona sayughfaru lanaa Wa-iny ya'tihim 'aradun misluhoo ya'khuzooh; alam yu'khaz 'alaihim meesaaqul Kitaabi an laa yaqooloo 'alal laahi illal haqqa Wa-darasoo maa feeh; wad-Daarul Aakhirtu khairul lil-lazeena yattaqoon; afalaa ta'qiloon

170.t: Those who devote themselves to the teachings of the Book and are steadfast in prayer (should know that) the reward of those who reform themselves will not be lost.
170.tr: Wallazeena yumas-sikoona bil-Kitaabi Wa-aqaamus Salaata innaa laa nudeeu 'ajral musliheen

171.t: When We raised the mount above them as a shadow and made it speak to them, they thought that it would fall on them. We told them to devote themselves decisively to what was given to them and follow its guidance so that they would have fear of God.
171.tr: Wa-iz nataqnal jabala fawqahum ka-annahoo zullatunw Wa-zannooo annahoo waaqi'un bihim khuzoo maaa aatainaakum biquwwatinw wazkuroo maa feehi la'allakum tattaqoon

172.t: When your Lord asked all the offspring of Adam (before their birth), "Am I not your Lord?" All of them testified and bore witness to their testimony that on the Day of Judgment they would not say, "We were not aware of this (fact),"
172.tr: Wa-iz akhaza Rabbuka min Baneee Aadama min zuhoorihim zurriyyatahum Wa-ashhadahum 'alaa anfusihim alastu bi-Rabbikum qaaloo balaa shahidnaaa; an taqooloo Yawmal Qiyaamati innaa kunnaa 'an haazaa ghaafileen

173.t: or say, "Our fathers worshipped idols before us and we as their descendants followed them. Would you then destroy us because of what the followers of falsehood have done?"
173.tr: Aw taqoolooo innamaaa ashraka aabaaa'unaa min qablu Wa-kunnaa zurriyyatan min ba'dihim 'a-fa-tuhlikunaa bi-maa fa'alal mubtiloon

174.t: Thus do We explain Our revelations so that they might return to (the right path).

175.t: (Muhammad), tell them the story of the person whom We inspired with Our guidance, but who detached himself from it and who was then pursued by Satan until he turned into a rebel.
175.tr: Watlu 'alaihim naba allazeee aatainaahu Aayaatinaa fansalakha minhaa fa-atba'a hush-Shaytaanoo fakaana minal ghaaween

176.t: Had We wanted, We could have raised him to an exalted position but he clung to his earthly life and followed his own (evil) desires. Such person's bad habits are like those of a lazy dog (in a warm climate) who always has its tongue hanging out whether you chase it away or leave it alone. Such are the people who have called Our revelations mere lies. (Muhammad), tell them such stories so that perhaps they will think.
176.tr: Wa-law shi'naa larafa'naahu bihaa Wa-laakin-nahooo akhlada ilal ardi wattaba'a hawaah; famasaluhoo kamasalil kalbi in tahmil 'alaihi yalhas aw tatruk-hu yalhas; zaalika masalul qawmil lazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa; faqsusil qasasa la'allahum yatafakkaroon

177.t: How terrible is the example of those who have rejected Our revelations and have done injustice only to themselves!
177.tr: Saaa'a masalanil qawmul lazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-anfusahum kaanoo yazlimoon

178.t: Those whom God has guided have the true guidance, but those whom He has caused to go astray are certainly lost.
178.tr: Mai yahdil laahu fa-huwal muhtadee Wa-mai yudlil fa-ulaaa'ika humul khaasiroon

179.t: We have destined many men and jinn for hell. They have hearts but do not understand, eyes but do not see. They have ears but do not hear. They are worse than lost cattle. These are the heedless ones.
179.tr: Wa-laqad zara'naa li-jahannama kaseeran minal jinni wal-insi lahum quloobul laa yafqahoona bihaa Wa-lahum a'yunul laa yubisiroona bihaa Wa-lahum aazaanul laa yasma'oona bihaa; ulaaa'ika kal-an'aami bal hum adall; ulaaa'ika humul ghaafiloon

180.t: God has the most blessed Names. You should address Him in your worship by these Names and keep away from those who pervert them. They will be recompensed for their (evil) deeds.
180.tr: Wa-lillaahil Asmaaa-'ul Husnaa fad'oohu bihaa Wa-zarul lazeena yulhidoona feee Asmaaa'ih; sa-yujzawna maa kaanoo ya'maloon

181.t: Among Our creatures are a group who guide and judge with the Truth.
181.tr: Wa-mimman khalaqnaaa ummatuny yahdoona bilhaqqi Wa-bihee ya'diloon

182.t: We gradually lead those who have called Our revelations mere lies, to destruction. Their destruction will be such that they will not even notice how it seized them.
182.tr: Wallazeena kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa sanastadrijuhum min haisu laa ya'lamoon

183.t: Though I have given them a respite, My plan against them is well established.

184.t: Why will they not understand that their companion (Muhammad) is not possessed by jinn. (Muhammad) is only a (Divinely) authorized preacher.
184.tr: Awalam yatafakkaroo maa bisaahibihim min jinnah; in huwa illaa nazeerun mubeen

185.t: Have they not considered the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything that God has created? Perhaps death approaches them. In what kind of guidance can they have faith besides that of the Quran?
185.tr: Awalam yanzuroo fee malakootis samaawaati wal-ardi Wa-maa khalaqal laahu min shai'inw Wa-an 'asaaa ai yakoona qadiq taraba ajaluhum fa-bi-ayyi hadeesin ba'dahoo yu'minoon

186.t: No one can guide those whom God has caused to go astray and has left to continue blindly in their rebellion.
186.tr: Mai yudlil lillaahu falaa haadiya lah; Wa-yazaruhum fee tughyaanihim ya'mahoon

187.t: They ask you (Muhammad), "When will the Day of Judgment be?" Tell them, "My Lord knows best. It is He who has appointed its time. It will be a grave hour both in the heavens and the earth. It will only approach you suddenly." They say, "It seems that you know about the coming of the Day of Judgment." Tell them, "Only God knows about it and most people do not know."
187.tr: Yas'aloonaka 'anis Saa'ati aiyaana mursaahaa qul innamaa 'ilmuhaa 'inda Rabbee laa yujalleehaa liwaqtihaaa illaa Hoo; saqulat fis samaawaati wal-ard; laa ta'teekum illaa baghtah; yas'aloonaka ka-annaka hafiyyun 'anhaa qul innamaa 'ilmuhaa 'indal laahi Wa-laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon

188.t: (Muhammad), say, "I have no control over my benefits or sufferings, without the will of God. Had I known about the unseen, I would have gained much good and would have faced no suffering. I am only a warner and I preach the glad news to the believing people."
188.tr: Qul laaa amliku linafsee naf'anw Wa-laa darran illaa maa shaaa'al laah; Wa-law kuntu a'lamul ghaiba lastaksartu minal khairi Wa-maa massaniyas soo'; in ana illaa nazeerunw Wa-basheerul liqawminy yu'minoon

189.t: It is God Who created you from a single soul and out of it made its spouse to bring it comfort. When he (man) engaged in carnal relations with her, she conceived a light burden which she had to carry. When the baby grew in her womb, they (husband and wife) both prayed to their Lord, "If You grant us a healthy son we shall certainly give you thanks."
189.tr: Huwal lazee khalaqakum min nafsinw waahidatinw Wa-ja'ala minhaa zawjahaa liyas-kuna ilaihaa falammaa taghash-shaahaa hamalat hamlan khafeefan famarrat bihee falammaaa asqalad da'a-wal laaha Rabbahumaa la'in aataitana saalihal lanakoonanna minash shaakireen

190.t: When they were given a healthy son, they began to love him as much as they loved God. God is too exalted to be loved equally to anything else.
190.tr: Falammaaa aataahumaa saalihan ja'alaa lahoo shurakaaa'a feemaaa aataahumaa; fata'aalal laahu 'ammaa yushrikoon

191.t: Do they (the pagans) consider things that do not create anything but are themselves created equal to God?
191.tr: A-yushrikoona maa laa yakhluqu shai'anw Wa-hum yukhlaqoon

192.t: The idols are things that are not able to help others or even themselves.
192.tr: Wa-laa yastatee'oona lahum nasranw Wa-laaa anfusahum yansuroon

193.t: Believers, even if you invite them to true guidance, they will not follow you. It makes no difference whether you invite them or whether you keep quiet.
193.tr: Wa-in tad'oohum ilal hudaa laa yattabi'ookum; sawaaa'un 'alaikum a-da'awtumoohum 'am antum saamitoon

194.t: Those whom you (pagans) worship besides God, are themselves servants just like yourselves. If your claim was true, they should answer your prayers.
194.tr: Innal lazeena tad'oona min doonil laahi 'ibaadun amsaalukum fad'oohum fal-yastajeeboo lakum in kuntum saadiqeen

195.t: Do they (the idols) have feet to walk, hands to hold things, eyes to see, and ears to hear? (Muhammad), tell them (the pagans) to call on their idols for help and to plan against Me without delay.
195.tr: A-lahum arjuluny yamshoona bihaa 'am lahum 'aidiny yabtishoona bihaaa 'am lahum a'yunuy yubsiroona bihaaa 'am lahum aazaanuny yasma'oona bihaa; qulid 'oo shurakaaa'akum thumma keedooni falaa tunziroon

196.t: The (true) Guardian is certainly God who has revealed the Book and is the Guardian of the righteous ones.
196.tr: Inna waliyyial laahul lazee nazzalal Kitaaba Wa-Huwa yatawallas saaliheen

197.t: The idols which you (the pagans) worship besides God can neither help you nor themselves.
197.tr: Wallazeena tad'oona min doonihee laa yastatee'oona nasrakum Wa-laaa anfusahum yansuroon

198.t: (Muhammad), if you invite them to the right guidance, they will not listen to you. You will see them looking at you but they do not really see.
198.tr: Wa-in tad'oohum ilal hudaa laa yasma'oo Wa-taraahum yanzuroona ilaika Wa-hum laa yubsiroon

199.t: Have forgiveness, preach the truth, and keep away from the ignorant ones.

200.t: If Satan will try to seduce you, seek refuge from God. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
200.tr: Wa-immaa yanzaghannaka minash Shaitaani nazghun fasta'iz billaah; innahoo Samee'un Aleem

201.t: When a satanic thought starts to bother the pious ones, they understand and see the light
201.tr: Innal lazeenat taqaw izaa massahum taaa'ifun minash Shaitaani tazakkaroo fa-izaa hum mubsiroon

202.t: while their brethren ceaselessly try to drag them into error.
202.tr: Wa-ikhwaanuhum yamuddoonahum fil ghayyi thumma laa yuqsiroon

203.t: If you, (Muhammad), do not show them a miracle, they will keep on insisting that you must show them one. Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This (Quran) contains wisdom for you from your Lord. It contains guidance and mercy for those who have faith.
203.tr: Wa-izaa lam ta'tihim bi-aayatin qaaloo law-laj tabai-tahaa; qul innamaaa attabi'u maa yoohaaa ilaiya mir Rabbee; haazaa basaaa'iru mir Rabbikum Wa-hudanw Wa-rahmatul liqawminy yu'minoon

204.t: Whenever the Quran is recited (to you), listen to it quietly so that you may receive mercy.
204.tr: Wa-izaa quri'al Quraanu fastami'oo lahoo Wa-ansitoo la-'allakum turhamoon

205.t: Remember your Lord deep within yourselves, humbly and privately - instead of shouting out loud - (in prayer) in the mornings and evenings and do not be of the heedless ones.
205.tr: Wazkur Rabbaka fee nafsika tadarru'anw Wa-kheefatanw Wa-doonal jahri minal qawli bilghuduwwi wal-aasali Wa-laa takum minal ghaafileen

206.t: Those who are near to your Lord do not disdain from worshipping Him. They glorify Him and prostrate themselves (in obedience to Him).
206.tr: Innal lazeena 'inda Rabbika laa yastakbiroona 'an 'ibaadatihee Wa-yusabbihoonahoo Wa-lahoo yasjudoon
